_comment: Do not manually edit this file, or update these source phrases in Crowdin. The source of truth for English strings are in the code source

rms.subtitle: An application to create and modify views for Visual Query Builder

errors.query-type-mandatory: At least one query type should be enabled

bmc-welcome.default-community-description: Connect. Share. Discover. Join discussions with peers and experts on BMC products and solutions.
bmc-welcome.default-documentation-description: Go through the product documentation to understand all the Reporting features and how to use them.
bmc-welcome.default-video-description: View video how-tos, overviews, and demos about BMC products and solutions on the BMC YouTube channel.

calc-fields.create-desc: can create or update calculated fields

datasource.explore-desc: can use explore mode for datasources

roles.delete-confirmation: Are you sure you want to delete this role?

rms.description: Reporting Metadata Studio is a Windows application based on Pentaho Metadata Editor. It is used to create customized views or modify a copy of an out-of-the-box view. For more information, see the online documentation.

bmc.route-error: Oops... some unexpected error has occurred.

search.comfirm-export: Do you want to export the {{dashCount}} selected dashboard(s)?

datetime-format.description: This will change the default time format used in dashboards, panels and reports.
datetime-format.label: Datetime Format

query-editor.modal-close-confirmation: The current query will be lost. Do you want to continue?
query-editor.service-management-note: Note: Applicable only to the Service Management query type.

connections.redirect-notice: <0>Data sources have a new home! You can discover new data sources or manage existing ones in the Connections page, accessible from the main menu.</0><1>Go to connections</1>

dashboard.panel-copied: Panel copied. Click **Add panel** icon to paste.

remove-panel.confirmation-text: Are you sure you want to remove this panel?
remove-panel.title: Remove panel

dashboard-import.existing-library-panels-desc: List of existing library panels. These panels are not affected by the import.
dashboard-import.new-library-panels-desc: List of new library panels that will get imported.
dashboard-import.uid-desc: The unique identifier (UID) of a dashboard can be used for uniquely identify a dashboard between multiple Grafana installs. The UID allows having consistent URLs for accessing dashboards so changing the title of a dashboard will not break any bookmarked links to that dashboard.
dashboard-import.view-selection-tooltip: Do not change the pre-selected view

edit-panel.actual-description: Make same size as on the dashboard
edit-panel.apply-tooltip: Apply changes and go back to dashboard

legend.values-description: Select values or calculations to show in legend

edit-panel.library-panels-description: Reusable panels you can share between multiple dashboards.

panel-options.repeat-by-variable-description: Repeat this panel for each value in the selected variable. This is not visible while in edit mode. You need to go back to dashboard and then update the variable or reload the dashboard.

query.empty-query-edit-warning: An empty query name is not allowed

query-options.interval-tooltip: The evaluated interval that is sent to data source and is used in <1>$__interval</1> and <4>$__interval_ms</4>. This value is not exactly equal to <7>Time range / max data points</7>, it will approximate a series of magic number.
query-options.max-data-points-tooltip: The maximum data points per series. Used directly by some data sources and used in calculation of auto interval. With streaming data this value is used for the rolling buffer.
query-options.min-interval-tooltip: A lower limit for the interval. Recommended to be set to write frequency, for example <2>1m</2> if your data is written every minute. Default value can be set in data source settings for most data sources.
query-options.relative-time-tooltip: Overrides the relative time range for individual panels, which causes them to be different than what is selected in the dashboard time picker in the top-right corner of the dashboard. For example to configure the Last 5 minutes the Relative time should be <1>now-5m</1> and <3>5m</3>, or variables like <5>$_relativeTime</5>.
query-options.time-shift-tooltip: Overrides the time range for individual panels by shifting its start and end relative to the time picker. For example to configure the Last 1h the Time shift should be <1>now-1h</1> and <4>1h</4>, or variables like <6>$_timeShift</6>.

tooltip.hover-proximity-description: How close the cursor must be to a point to trigger the tooltip, in pixels

save-dashboard.cant-save-provisioned: This dashboard cannot be saved from the BMC Helix Dashboards because it has been provisioned from another source. Copy the JSON or save it to a file below, then you can update your dashboard in the provisioning source.
save-dashboard.curr-time-as-default: Save current time range as dashboard default
save-dashboard.curr-var-as-default: Save current variable values as dashboard default
save-dashboard.description-placeholder-text: Add a note to describe your changes.

errors.dash-folder-same-name: Dashboard name cannot be the same as folder name

edit-form.all-panels-desc: Send the annotation data to all panels that support annotations
edit-form.all-panels-except-desc: Do not send annotation data to the following panels
edit-form.color-desc: Color to use for the annotation event markers
edit-form.enabled-desc: When enabled the annotation query is issued every dashboard refresh
edit-form.hidden-desc: Annotation queries can be toggled on or off at the top of the dashboard. With this option checked this toggle will be hidden.

filter-by.dashboard-desc: Query for events created on this dashboard and show them in the panels where they where created
filter-by.tags-desc: This will fetch any annotation events that match the tags filter

query-editor.match-any-desc: Enabling this returns annotations that match any of the tags specified below

query-type.annotation-desc: Show annotations or alerts managed by grafana

query-editor.tag-field-desc: <0>Specify a list of tags to match. To specify a key and value tag use `key:value` syntax.</0>

edit-form.selected-panels-desc: Send the annotations to the explicitly listed panels

annotation.info-body:
Annotations provide a way to integrate event data into your graphs. They are visualized as vertical lines
          and icons on all graph panels. When you hover over an annotation icon you can get event text & tags for
          the event. You can add annotation events directly from grafana by holding CTRL or CMD + click on graph (or
          drag region). These will be stored in Grafana's annotation database.
annotation.info-body-doc-link: Checkout the <0>Annotations documentation</0> for more information.
annotation.title: There are no custom annotation queries added yet

settings.confirm-delete-text: Do you want to delete this dashboard?

dashboard-link-list.html-text: Dashboard Links allow you to place links to other dashboards and web sites directly below the dashboard header.
dashboard-link-list.title-text: There are no dashboard links added yet

links.description-edit-link: Edit a specific link of your dashboard

editor.exlude-variable-desc: Select to exclude the variable from the query
editor.include-all-desc: Enables an option to include all variable values
editor.multi-value-desc: Enables multiple values to be selected at the same time

ad-hoc-filters.description: Add key/value filters on the fly.
ad-hoc-filters.name: Ad hoc filters

constant.description: Define a hidden constant variable, useful for metric prefixes in dashboards you want to share.
constant.name: Constant

data-source.description: Enables you to dynamically switch the data source for multiple panels.
data-source.name: Data source

query.description: Variable values are fetched from a datasource query
query.name: Query

textbox.description: Define a textbox variable, where users can enter any arbitrary string
textbox.name: Text box

data-source.name-filter-desc1: Regex filter for which data source instances to choose from in the variable value list. Leave empty for all.
data-source.title: Data source options

internal.auto-option-description: Dynamically calculates interval by dividing time range by the count specified
internal.min-interval-description: The calculated value will not go below this threshold
internal.step-count-description: How many times the current time range should be divided to calculate the value
internal.title: Interval options

query.refresh-desc: When to update the values of this variable
query.regex-editor-text: <0>Optional, if you want to extract part of a series name or metric node segment.<1></1>Named capture groups can be used to separate the display text and value (<3>see examples</3>).</0>
query.sort-desc: How to sort the values of this variable

name.description: The name of the template variable. (Max. 50 characters)

variables.info-body: Variables enable more interactive and dynamic dashboards. Instead of hard-coding things like server or sensor names in your metric queries you can use variables in their place. Variables are shown as list boxes at the top of the dashboard. These drop-down lists make it easy to change the data being displayed in your dashboard. Check out the <0>Templates and variables documentation</0> for more information.

delete.body: Are you sure you want to delete variable "{{varName}}"?

variable-editor-list-row.exclamation-triangle-title: This variable is not referenced by any variable or dashboard.

variables-unknown-table.decription: No renamed or missing variables found.
variables-unknown-table.info-circle-description: Click to expand a list with all variable references that have been renamed or are missing from the dashboard.
variables-unknown-table.title: Renamed or missing variables

unsaved-modal.title: Unsaved changes

to-dashboard.choose-dashboard-text: Select in which dashboard the panel will be created.
to-dashboard.choose-dashboard-type-text: Choose where to add the panel.

errors.general: Something went wrong. Please try again.
errors.navigation-to-dashboard: Could not navigate to the selected dashboard. Please try again.
errors.panel-to-dashboard-err: Could not add panel to dashboard. Please try again.
errors.unable-fetch-dash-info: Could not fetch dashboard information. Please try again.

delete.cannot-delete-text: This library panel can not be deleted because it is connected to {{message}} dashboard(s). Remove the library panel from the dashboards listed below and retry.
delete.confirmation-text: Do you want to delete this panel?
delete.title: Delete library panel

unlink.body: If you unlink this panel, you will be able to edit it without affecting any other dashboards. However, once you make a change you will not be able to revert to its original reusable panel.
unlink.title: Do you really want to unlink this panel?

page-not-found.load-error: Oops... we could not load that page.
page-not-found.load-error-subtext: <0>This page might have been removed, had its name changed, or is temporarily unavailable.</0><1>Go back to the <1>Home Page</1>, or contact <3>BMC Support</3>.</1>

confirm-modal.body: This will update the preferences for the whole organization. Are you sure you want to update the preferences?
confirm-modal.title: Confirm preferences update

users-and-access.search-user-placeholder-text: Search user by login, email or name

basic-settings.schedule-type-desc: Choose where the report will be sent/saved to
basic-settings.title: Basic settings

filter-settings.dashboard-variables-description: Generate report with the form specified dashboard variables. If filtering is set to 'Default', the report will use the saved dashboard variables, If set to custom it will use the current session dashboard variables.
filter-settings.time-range-description: Generate report with the form specified time range. If custom time range is 'Default', the time range from the report's dashboards is used.
filter-settings.title: Filter settings
filter-settings.use-current-variable-description: The recent selected variables of the dashboard
filter-settings.use-saved-variable-description: The already saved variables in the report

mail-settings.recipient-search: Type to search or add another recipient
mail-settings.subject: Subject
mail-settings.title: Mail settings

schedule-settings.hours-required: Hours are required with this frequency
schedule-settings.month-days-required: Month days are required with this frequency
schedule-settings.months-required: Months are required with this frequency
schedule-settings.time-invalid: Time format is invalid. Required format is 'mm', and valid values are 0-59
schedule-settings.title: Schedule
schedule-settings.week-days-required: Week days are required with this frequency

style-settings.table-scaling-description: Select an option to adjust the width of the table columns.

nav.subtitle: Create and manage reports distributed via Email or FTP
nav.title: Scheduled Reports

delete-modal.delete-reports-body: This action will delete the following content:
